intro: Phlegmariurus orizabae, commonly known as the Orizaba feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth and small, ovate leaves that are typically covered with a thick layer of papilla. The plant is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. It is native to Mexico and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its habitat.
